text: Decided to try this place cause it is right down the road. We ordered the dinner combos pepper steak and kung pow chicken. It includes soup, an egg roll or crab puffs, an entree and white rice. My husband wanted fried rice and it was $3.00 extra. We both got the eggflower soup. It was disgusting. Not a fan of any soup at a Chinese restaurant except for wonton soup, which they didn't have. The waitress asked how it was and I said I didn't like it could i try the other option, hot and sour soup. This was by far worse, and maybe I'm biased cause I don't care for egg soup anything, but is this actually exceptible for consumption,  yuck! So the lady comes back and asks how is it? I told her it was bad and I couldn't eat it. She reluctantly took it away and said I take it off. She returned to our table with the egg roll and crab puffs and said she would give us each an egg roll since we didn't like the soup. That was fine and I appreciated her gesture. The crab puffs and egg rolls were over fried and tasted pretty bad, with mostly soggy cabbage on the inside. The food finally arrives and the portions are very nice size.   The food was ok, but not wonderful. My chicken dish had hardly any chicken and mostly veggies. The pepper steak was a little over cooked, but the flavor was good. The place was dead except for a few at the bar and one other table. We sat around waiting for our check for about 15 mins though. Not very good service. There is another place right down the road I enjoyed much better!
The sweet and sour chicken was deliciously crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The crab puffs were really good too. Would love to go again.

I absolutely love this restaurant when the owners aren't around.  I've been ordering from them for YEARS! The gentlemen that delivers my food has always been gracious and polite.  In fact, every time I've dealt with the staff it's been pleasant.  HOWEVER, every single time I've called during lunch hours and the owners are present, I'm given a hard time.  Today when I called for a delivery order, I heard the lady (owner) in the background yelling at the kid that took my order while I was on hold.  My order was $2 short of the minimum delivery amount.  The kid was told to tell me my location is too far away.  "Tell them to just come pick it up!" she yelled at him, all the while I'm on the phone listening to her scream at him.  This has happened before and quite honestly, the owner should learn some manners and personal awareness.  The poor kid nervously apologized to me as I decided to cancel my order.  Thanks anyway!!! The owner should understand that this city is flooded with Chinese restaurants and be grateful she has such a great staff.

I love this place. My boyfriend and I are from back east and have been on a search for good Chinese on this side of town since we moved here. The search is over. Finally, a Chinese place where the food isn't loaded with sugar and fillers. We have ordered pot stickers, the BBQ sliced pork appetizer, general Chicken, beef with vegetables, king pow chicken, Peking duck and so on. We're starting think everything may be good on the menu. There's no doubt about it, this is the best Chinese in the city of Phoenix. Not to mention the staff is friendly and work efficiently. Oh and for you cranky yelpers complaining about the prices and "small portions," you're delusional. I'm sorry. That was rude, but maybe you would be happier at the all-you-can-eat MSG factory down the road. It's only $5.99.

The man who took my food order was genuinely nice ans when he delivered my food I was even more impressed. Fast delivery great customer service excellent food. I will be a regular because of my experience

Definitely have had better! I ate here at the behest of some friends who told me Autumn Court has the advantage over Desert Jade down the street. Now, Desert Jade is like a second family room to me as I've been eating there since I was a wee one so it's hard to make a case for anything but their delicious food. I tried the Hong Kong Chow Mein with shrimp - generous portion of shrimp served over pretty lackluster chow mein noodles. The tea was weak. The potstickers were  actually quite good. Overall though, Autumn Court doesn't have the same powerful flavors (and lovely memories) as Desert Jade.

I'm honestly surprised that this place has 3 1/2 stars... My boyfriend and I ordered take out from here tonight & we got the potstickers app. They were actually pretty good but the sauce that came w/ them came in a teeny little container, which was a little odd for dipping but whatevz. We each got an entree too... he got General Tao's Chicken and I decided on the Orange Peel Beef -- both with an order of fried rice. I tried his chicken and honestly it was just okay, quality was pretty equivalent to Panda Express, my beef was alright as well but I'd never eat it again. But what was REALLY disappointing was the fried rice.... It was like they made it in a dirty pan. It was literally foul and tasted burnt somehow. We both couldn't stomach it so I actually stopped eating to make some jasmine rice that I had in my pantry. We're definitely not coming back!

I'm a regular at Autumn Court for several reasons.  They already know me when I walk in and seat us right away.  The service is always friendly, the food is always good and the drinks are delicious, must try the Tom Collins here, yummy!  For food try the shrimp with sizzling vegetables, three treasures, mongolian beef and the low mein, you will not be disappointed. Their happy hour menu has many good deals as well.  Another awesome thing is that it's a nice place to come and relax when you don't want to be in a loud crazy spot, you just want a nice relaxing meal.  It's very laid back and has a wonderful staff.  Highly recommend it.

Disclaimer: AC is within walking distance of my place, so I probably am a bit biased.  Summary: A nice, comfortable little restaurant with an underrated happy hour and friendly (though sometimes hard to understand) service.  I come here mostly for the sushi - not because it's outstanding but rather since Zen 32 closed shop it's the only game in the immediate neighborhood and, though very limited (we're talking 10 options) it's not horrible.  Solid happy hour - discounts on the sushi and other items like pot stickers, crab puffs & edamame.  Good deals on sake bombers and beer which they now offer 2-3 kinds on tap.  The main dishes are tasty and ample.  It does a pretty good takeout business.  Friendly bartenders and waitstaff, ample parking.  If you're looking for the 'in' crowd you won't find it here - you're better off making your way elsewhere.
If you are from Chicago or New York, and you want Beef Egg Foo Yung done the right way, look no further! I was so homesick, I used to order Beef Egg Foo Yung from Autumn Court, almost everyday!

I have been here many many many times. I live down the street and have never had any issues other than a few people having fun and the bar and yelling at times. Other than that great service and food it to be had here.   Edit:Last time I went the food was sub par and no longer Vegan friendly.

Our family loves Autumn Court,excellent customer service provided by Manager Joann and all her wonderful staff!  Off course the appetizers and entrees are really delicious and very well prepared! This restaurant deserves the best ratings possible!  The Chicken and Beef Fried Rices are mouthwatering!  Joann is very attentive,kind,sweet and really warm hearted! She treats all customers with the utmost respect and service!  My family and I feel at home here and highly recommend this super restaurant!  Sincerely Leo and Family from Ahwatukee!

"Sizzling rice soup is the only thing that sizzles"  Went here for lunch with my wife and mother-in-law because we were in the mood for Chinese food.  Although it was our first time, it may be our last time as well.  I ordered the Kung Pao chicken which as filled with thick sauce which did blend the chicken and vegetable together, but more like made everything taste the same.  My wife had the eggplant chicken which I think tasted the same as the Kung Pao chicken as well.  Should have called it Kung Pao eggplant chicken.  The dinning room is similar to that of a lodge converted to restaurant.  I did order the sizzling rice soup which was good, but there wasn't enough soup as the rice soaked it all up.  Price was a little high for portion sizes I thought.  Although the owner was very nice and cordial that is the reason I gave this 2 stars.  There is very little authenticity to the restaurant as the ROA is a dismal 10%, ratio of authenticity is #of ethnic patrons/#total patrons.

We ordered over $40 of food on Thanksgiving and were very disappointed in numerous ways. The food took over an hour and a half to arrive. No big deal, they were busy. But, our food was not only cold and the soda watered down because the ice had melted but we received no serving ware and even after reheating, the food did not taste good. We called and were told that we would have a credit for our next order. We felt that was fair. Today we called to order food and guess what? No record of the issue. The woman that we spoke to asked numerous questions (not unexpected) but instead of simply replacing the order, she said she had to make some calls. Strike three. My wife and I have both worked in the restaurant business for many years and understand that there are people that complain for no reason. But, after all the information and explanation my wife went through over the phone, to be told "sorry, can't help you" was too much. I hope this review not only helps other diners decide whether or not to patronize this restaurant but also helps the restaurant understand the value of being given a second chance and blowing it. UPDATE. We have received a call back from the restaurant and they are working to make this issue good. Although it should not have been this difficult, kudos to them for following up. Update #2: Wow. I am updating this as I eat. We called today and our order was replaced. My expectations were not very high. We were actually delivered the wrong order. The reaction of the manager who answered when we called to tell them was very empathetic and apologetic. Our food was here within five minutes. The food, is delicious!! Obviously freshly steamed vegetables, moist, tasty rice, fresh beef and chicken. Even with the "of all times" delivery mistake, we are very happy with the resolution to the issue. I am changing my rating to reflect the effort put in to make us happy customers.
I went there for the first time tonight with a friend. The food was delicious and the service was great. I will definitely return here again. Also the prices are reasonable.

We just ordered the honey chicken. Only to get it cold. And when I said something about it , they actually put it in the microwave. And brought it back to me. And my plate had food on it from the person before me. I WILL NOT BE BACK AGAIN!!!
The best sweet and sour soup ever!  Food is delicious and favorable.  Delivery is pretty good, nice people.

This has become one of my favorite chinese spots. Unlike the post before, my favorite dish here happens to be the eggplant. I also think the lo mein and the orange beef are quite tasty. The service can leave a bit to be desired sometimes, but I, and everyone I have brought there have rarely been dissapointed by the food.  As for the ambience, for a small restaurant in Phoenix to actually being located in a free standing building and not in a stripmall is already a huge plus. I have seen this space go through several different incarnations and they seem to have done pretty good with what they had without breaking the bank...definitley not swank, but decor is not why you come here.  Now if you want REALLY bad service,  go to my absolute favorite Thai joint in the same shopping center, Thai Lahnai. Then you can really get mistreated! (but the traditional fare is perfect!)

This is absolutely my favorite restaurant in Phoenix - you will not be disappointed. The wait staff there is amazing and remembers their customers, and the place has great character. The hot tea is so good, you must get it! The crab puffs literally melt in your mouth, and the sauce that comes with them is perfect. As far as entrees go, I've tried many and have not been disappointed. The beef lo mein is awesome, as is the Kung pao chicken or shrimp.  Highly recommend!

This place is now in my 'hood after my recent move to East Phoenix and I kept meaning to try it out but just didn't get around to it until I spotted my Yelp friends' high recommendations, and of course they were right - this place rocks. The Lemon Pepper Shrimp was so delicious (and yes, they have brown rice). We also ordered the hot n sour soup, which - vegetarians beware - is generously filled with not just tofu, but shrimp and pork as well. Not a pork eater myself, I'll have to take my cohort's word for it that it was equally delicious. Meals were reasonably priced, especially the chef's specials. Service was fine - quite attentive, actually. Atmosphere was interesting - nothing to rave about, but we happened to be there as the sun was setting, and the place seemed to take on a bit of a cooler vibe the darker it got. Enough so that we took our time finishing up our Sake Bombers and just hung out for a while. Oh yeah, we'll be back.

I came here for lunch, and I was incredibly impressed with the service, ambience and tastiness of the food. It's a simple but airy and friendly place, with little touches of China all over. Our server was so sweet and attentive, and didn't even up charge my friend for fried rice. I ordered the Sweet and Sour chicken lunch combination, which was super tasty with just the right amount of flavor. I will definitely be back again, and I think I just found my new favorite Chinese place.

The outside looked a little scary, but the food was very good. I think the owner waited on us and was very nice. The fried rice was top notch. We had the chicken and cashews and veggie delight. We did not go for happy hour.

Always pretty solid Chinese food. It's better when eaten in versus take out. The main dishes are usually really good. The sushi is okay. Atmosphere at the bar is great though. I can see why so many people sit at the bar and have dinner.
My Daughter ordered take out a couple of times from Autumn Court when we were visiting. I was very impressed with the Egg Foo Yung. The house fried rice was very good as well. Good eats!

Best Chinese food I've had in years! I ordered the Hong Kong Chow Mein with beef and it was so wonderful I finished the entire bowl. I must add that the iced tea is also exceptional! I will definitly return.
We got delivery and the food was great and the delivery was on schedule.  For a "Netflix and chill" kind of night this is a great spot to get food from.

The Wor Wonton Soup comes in a big container and has a flavorful broth, crisp veggies, lots of wontons and meat.  It is great with chili sauce in it.  I've heard the Peking Duck is great, but have yet to try it.

To quote my boyfriend, we like this place because "they're solid." Every time we order here, the food is great and fresh. I always get their sweet and sour chicken and I am never disappointed. Instead of chicken chunks coated in batter, this place uses a chicken breast with batter that I would describe to be a thin tempura like batter. There is no excess batter or fat chunks to deal with it. The service is fast and we see the same waiter every time we eat here. This is the my go to place for Chinese food.

I love this place. This is actually a chinese sushi bar and not japanese. They have chinese food, but they also have sushi.  The owner is very friendly and food is good. Be sure to check out their happy hour sushi menu 'cause it's inexpensive! The crunchy roll is my favorite.

We always hope the next time it'll be better.   Sadly there's just not enough Chinese restaurants to choose from that offers delivery.   Tonight's disappointments included scallops with ginger and scallions, maybe 5 or 6 small brown rubbery metallic items in a nasty flavored sauce.  Shrimp and veggies, poorly cleaned frozen shrimp in a bland sauce with very little veggies.  BBQ pork was a hit and a miss with the sauce, all pieces were ridiculously chewy.   House lo mein might of been the highlight next to the white rice but both were cold.  Anyone know of better options or better restaurants that deliver decent Chinese food in the arcadia area?

My wife and I ordered take-out from here for dinner while we were in town over the weekend. We ordered the general tso's chicken, kung pao chicken, and two orders of chicken lo mein. The food was awful. The wontons were just fried wonton wrapers with absolutely nothing inside of them. The chicken is tough and rubery. The lo mein had no flavor, and everything labled "spicy" had absolutely no spice. To be honest I would have enjoyed eating frozen chinese food rather than wasting the money on this place.

I love this place. My sister and I come in often, my favorite thing to get here is the hot n sour soup and the spider roll. The egg foo young is really yummy too. We always have the owner (or so I think he is the owner) as our server and he is SO adorable and sweet and gives great service!
Great Aisan food and daily happy hour specials on drinks and bites! Cool bartender too. Local Fave!

I don't really like to give a negative review after just one experience, I usually chalk that up to an off day or bad luck. But after two bad experiences in one week, well, here we are. I like the food at autmn court and have had a few good experiences with both take out and dine in but the service here has slipped exponentially.   The first order we placed this week was over the phone to pick up, but the person on the phone took our address and our card information, and hung up quickly - we weren't sure if they were coming to deliver it or if we were still picking it up. After 25 minutes and no food, we drove to autmn court (literally, a half a mile from our house) to see if our food was there. It wasn't - turns out the driver was on their way. We waited fifteen minutes and the deliverer still hasn't arrived, so we called just to make sure there wasn't a miscommunication. Shortly after, we got a call from the driver, who was lost. My husband navigated her to our house and we finally got our food.   The second order we placed was placed in person, we left to grab a few items from the grocery and came back about 20 minutes later (they told us it would be 15 minutes so I figured we'd be all good). We waited another 10 minutes before our food was ready and took it home. Well, silly me didn't check my food to make sure it was correct before we left, and turns out, it wasn't. I promptly turned around and went back to fix the order.   I told the bartender I had the wrong order. He said, "oh! Your food is over there." Oh, thank you. I grabbed my bag and checked it. I had to ask if there had been a change in management, or if they had been having issues lately, and the only thing he said was that they had new people on the phones (my order was placed in person), but that he "had been there for twelve years." Oh, good for you, friend. He didn't offer to rectify the issue or apologize.   Then I got home and my order was still wrong. Soup has a funny way of looking the same in dark lighting.   I think they probably still have good dine in service, and the patrons at the bar looked happy, but I won't be ordering out from here again.

Ordered food at 7:00PM. Called at 8:00PM and they said they were backed up and it would be two hours from time of order. Ok, fine I can understand that. At 8:40PM I got a text from GrubHub that my order had been cancelled. When I called, the person I spoke with was unapologetic and couldn't explain why my order had been cancelled an hour and forty minutes after it had been placed and after I had previously called. Very frustrating. Will not ever go back.

Why can't they get the orders right??  I've ordered a few times from them and the food is fine. Nothing special. My issue is they can't get the order correct. How hard is it to get fried rice?! The last two times ordered they don't include it in delivery via Grubhub. The first time they missed it so I called the restaurant and the manager told me he doesn't check Grubhub orders and I should use another service. WHAT!? mistakenly I tried them again through Grubhub and same issue. I called and the restaurant staff said they can't give a refund. So I called Grubhub and got a refund. This is the last time!  This isn't a big problem to solve-get your orders correct!!!! I'll find somewhere else to order from

This is probably my favorite old school Chinese restaurant in the Valley.  The quality of the food is always consistent and the service very friendly.  My favorite is their kung pao veggies.  They include a nice selection of veggies in the dish and the sauce is nice and spicy.  I have also enjoyed their pepper beef and orange chicken.  I know someone who always gets their egg foo young and loves it.  The vegetable spring rolls are also very good and so is their egg drop soup.  The atmosphere is nice and quiet, making it a great place to sit and dine, either in a group or alone.

Good service. They need a better happy hour menu though, maybe add a few more rolls to it. It's just kind of blah... If there were more options I'd go out of my way for it and come here more often because I live close by but it's really just lacking a few things. I'd rather take a little drive up the road where I have a bigger selection of happy hour items

They love us there!  I go with my son Justin's cute girlfriend and I could very well pass for her older sister ~ Needless to say, we get a bunch of attention from these already attentive waiters, busmen, and hosts.    The egg rolls are scrumptious; well done on the outside and soft and fresh on the inside with orange sauce.  The Dan Dan Noodles were yummy with minced chicken and a nice texture.  The lemon chicken was an 8, thick sauce and fried nice.    The Cupcake Chardonnay was yummy; sipable, not chugable.  They actually had a great band there, every Saturday night!  The music had me dancing in my seat.  Songs like "Summertime", "The Girl From Nepamima" ( what is the correct spelling please!), etc ....  They aim to please and for a neighborhood restaurant, they get an 8!

First time eating at this place and it was so delicious. The chicken fried rice, the chicken snow peas and the egg rolls were perfect! I will definitely recommend it to friends and family. Someone said the service was bad? Idk who said that (maybe someone with there nose in the air) but we were greeted where we first entered and took our order. Will definitely be back thank you!

Ugh. For a restaurant to have won accolades as "Best Chinese Restaurant" from the Phoenix New Times, I expected way more from this place than what it offered.   You walk in and you feel you're more in a sports bar/English pub than a Chinese restaurant. The hostess seats you and then you're not served for 10 minutes. Eventually a server comes by and takes your order. I got the hot & sour soup and the eggplant w/chicken. I then proceeded to wait for 15 minutes before the soup arrived. The waitress was a little frenzied when she brought the soup and then disappeared again before I could ask her for some hot sauce.  I flagged down a busser for it instead, and he seemed pretty annoyed that I asked him to do something beyond wiping off tabletops. The soup was decent but it wasn't nearly the best that I've had.  I then waited another 15 minutes before got my entree. The eggplant tasted alright, but the ground chicken it was mixed with was downright disgusting. Smelled and tasted completely rotten. After four spoonfuls I decided I couldn't eat it anymore. But my waitress was nowhere to be found. I then spotted her from across the way and gave the "I'd like my check" hand signal. I then waited for 15 more minutes. I didn't see my waitress anywhere. I walked up to the hostess and ask for my check. She gave me my bill and asked if I want to pack the food for home, to which I declined.   I pay and leave the place, and see that my waitress is hanging out at the bus stop. Apparently her shift was over and she was going home, but I was left sitting there at the booth with a plate of smelly ground chicken and a mood of anger something large.  I'm really hoping this isn't the "best Chinese restaurant in Phoenix" because the service sucked donkey balls and the food was nowhere near good enough to make up for it. If there aren't any excellent Chinese restaurants in Phoenix, then I'm going to forlorn. Very forlorn. And that's not a good thing.

Stopped in for dinner Halloween night, the place was empty except for one other table. However the food was delish. The shrimp fried rice was excellent.  My girl had chicken lo mein and stated that was very good also. This was our first visit but it wont be the last.

Finally, a place that serves great Hot and Sour Soup.    For some reason, hot and sour soup always sounds good when I'm hungover.  With that said, I didn't feel like driving, so I was so glad to find a fairly high rated Chinese place that delivered.  I think you get a decent amount of food here, but it is a little pricey.  I've gotten the veggie lo-mein, kung-pao chicken, and shrimp with veggies on the three occasions that I've gotten delivery.  Pretty solid, but I will keep going back for the hot and sour soup.

I have had delivery multiple times and it has always been fast and hot. The food is good, love the option to upgrade to fried rice without having to order a whole other item. Their hot and sour soup is delicious (and can be spicy!) and they have the best fortune cookies , I know that sounds lame but really their's are really funny!

After calling 2 other places asking if they deliver to my address finally found this place that said yes.  Was told it would be 30 mins until delivery.  After 25 mins got a call back saying I was too far outside the coverage area and they couldn't deliver.  The only option they gave me was $3 credit for the delivery charge other wise I still had to pay.  25 minute drive later I finally got food, which was mediocre at best.  Sesame chicken wasn't even mixed, just a cup of sauce and fried chicken pieces.  Needless to say, won't ever order from there again!
Such beautiful look yummy food!

Worst.food.ever..uck Our usual place is closed on Sundays, so we decided on Autumn Court for delivery.  Haven't reviewed on Yelp for awhile and this food made me have to log on for sure!  We had to reheat the chicken and beef  dish on the stove and even then... it just sucked:(  Literally, the food tasted like frozen Chinese food that has been inside a freezer for too long, then flash cooked.  Save your self time and well earned cash! I warned you..:)

Ordered take out this evening.  The delivery was quick and all the food was there...the crabpuffs were soggy and had zero crab in it.  They did not seem to be cooked to order and maybe had been sitting?  A couple of the meals were luke warm which made the coating on them taste doughy.  With the multiple meals ordered there should have been more than 3 fortune cookies.

My boyfriend and I ordered takeout from this restaurant and were really disappointed. When calling to order our food, the guy on the phone didn't give us the total (no big deal we figured it couldn't be that much since we were looking at the prices on the website). After picking up the food we went home to eat. We found the chicken in containers with the sauce on the side (weird) but we were still willing to give it a chance. The chicken was dry and cold. The fried rice was also cold and tasted like it came out of a frozen bag. My boyfriend got sushi which was OK but still not great. The food is definitely not worth it for the price ($38 for 2 people). Not going to be coming back anytime soon.

Ordered delivery. Said would take 45 minutes. After 90 minutes called and they said food was in route. 40 minutes later still no food. Food may have been good but delivery was awful. I will never eat or order from them again.

Late night dinner decision, food was pretty good! Nice atmosphere and clean. Empty due to how late so you could hear the conversations the bar tenders were having and that would be my only complaint. I hate going to a business and hearing the staff complain or talk raunchy while at work when I'm trying to enjoy my meal. Decent pricing and sizing! Sesame chicken had great flavor! You should check them out if in the area.

I have been going to this restaurant since before their old one in Central Phoenix burned down... This is my go to comfort food for Phoenix.  The restaurant is comfy, service is quick, all food is so yummy and to date I haven't tried anything I disliked.  Their drink specials are quite phenomenal and that check-in special makes my heart happy.  On those days when I am binge watching my favorite tv show... the delivery comes fast and the food is always hot.

I love, love, love the House Fried Rice here.  They do not skimp on the nice size shrimp, the biggest I've seen in fried rice anywhere around here.  A healthy portion of chicken, beef and pork as well in the rice. The House Fried Rice is like $10...they raised the priced a couple of years ago.  If they raise the price any more I will have to go find some good competition.  Another favorite of mine was the Hot Sizzling Rice soup...very good.  The soup portion is huge! When they brought out that big kettle of a server bowl I was like wow! I've never done delivery as I live extremely close.  I love the atmosphere inside.  It's a great date place. It's a lot smaller than there original location downtown...However I'm not complaining because it's around the corner from me now! YAY!  I wouldn't bring small children.  The place is small and any screaming kids would definitely be heard throughout.

This is my absolute favorite Chinese food! The staff and owners and always extremely nice and helpful! The food is served extremely hot and super fast. I usually order takeout and within 10 minutes my food is ready and waiting. The ingredients are quality and no weird rubbery meat here. I haven't had anything at Autumn Court I haven't liked. My favorite is the cashew chicken which I order with brown sauce instead of white. I wish there were more cashews but I haven't ever asked for extra....next time!! Thank you AC!

Sad but true, in Arizona for a biz trip, ordered through UberEATS orange chicken. Nobody's thought they could messed up ORANGE CHICKENS. The rice is unruly.. TBH Panda Express is a million times better.

We had a great experience at Autumn Court. The food was delicious, fast, and plentiful. I had the sweet n sour shrimp and my husband had the honey chicken.  I would skip the lettuce wraps though. Service was great.  We'll be back!

I'm disappointed to see so many Yelpers give this place any more than one star. I would take Panda Express any day over this joint.  I ordered to-go from their lunch menu: sweet and sour chicken with vegetable lo mein and rice ($8).  It took nearly 30 minutes for it to arrive so now I'm rushing back to my office to chow it down. It's a good thing I didn't have to rush because the food was so bland I didn't even bother finishing it.   I should have known it was going to be gross when my server pulled the lo mein out of a giant rice steamer. The noodles were not seasoned (btw- where were the vegetables in my vegetable lo mein?!) and way over cook. Maybe it was because the noodles have been sitting in the rice steamer all day!  The sweet and sour chicken was pretty much non-seasoned, chicken nuggets swimming in sweet and sour sauce. There were some chunks of green peppers too but I couldn't get over the canned sweet and sour sauce that was infiltrating into my rice pile.  The best part of the meal were the fortune cookies. Mine said-- Next time, drive a bit east and you will find Pei Wei... or maybe that Chicago Hamburger Company across the street will do too!  Don't waste your money folks. Judging from the 4 people eating there during rush lunch hour, this place will be closed soon.

Do not eat here folks !I  don't even know where to start the pork sweet and sour was the consistency of dry chicken giblets and no sauce was even  received !! the only thing  we could eat was the chow mein and  i believe it made us sick ..granite I have never had food poisoning before. The egg roll tasted like the Sahara desert . I am sickened to think we could have ate anything after looking at how filthy the place is thanks yelp24 you would think they would watch out for us !

This is an awesome place for Happy Hour and delicious Chinese food.  The owner is incredibly kind, the service is great, and the value is great.  If you like Chinese food, this is a definite place to try.
90 minute wait and they lost my family's order. No excuse. No apologies. Wouldn't give our money back. No stars

So the yelpers who gave this place one star don't know what their  talking about. I just strayed from this place and ate at this god awful Sui Wok place and Boy will I never do that again.   Now I am from New York and having said that I will say that I have dined in some of the best places in china town and eaten some of the best hangover food in Brooklyn and when it comes to Chinese  this is as good as it gets in Phoenix.  The Hot and Sour soup is awesome. It has all the bells and whistles of the proper mushrooms and spices. The food is cheap and the portions are huge. Now OK yes the Orange chicken isn't going to be like PANDA EXPRESS because that's completely different but come on its spicy and good and not dry and you can really tell they are actually making everything instead of heating everything up from some plastic ready made food bag.  It was voted the best Chinese in the Phoenix New Times for a reason because it is the best in Phoenix. My only qualm is that some of the dishes are served as a chicken cutlet style instead of individual deep fried pieces.  Once again Phoenix the fact that some crappy place like Sui Wok is getting better reviews that this little gem makes me doubt your citizens even more!  Hooray for Autumn Court I love you!!!

Really not that good, ordered off the menu, they charge for "extra" vegetables, but my order of orange chicken had none, only white rice. So I was confused and disappointed. No veg's, I suggest you ask what exactly your order includes. And, it's not the best orange chicken. Maybe, just don't put yourself through it and go somewhere else.

Great and reasonably priced Chinese in the valley. I've ate here several times and the service has always been top notch and food always fresh! I've had several dishes here the latest being cashew chicken and everything was cooked perfect with flavor.   Their bar and bartenders are friendly and not scared to mix you a good drink (try the scorpion) and offer full service. The staff came by often to check the table and make sure everything was okay.   Great place to eat, if you get a chance stop in.   They also have good lunch specials!
Fantastic food, great service and wonderful people. We really enjoyed it. I had Moo Goo Gai Pan and Teriyaki Chicken.

I LOVE Autumn Court...The food..the atmosphere...the location...the service!  I seldom go to other asian restaurants, but when I do, I compare them to Autumn Court.  This one is still my favorite.  I don't like greasy, saucy chinese food at all so when this restaurant moved to my neighborhood I was so delighted by the fresh and nicely presented food and the prices are very fair here.  It's nice and dim in there at night, with cute little accents here and there..not your usual garish accesssories.  The owner/manager is always there and very very nice and attentive. They do take out, but if you do it, CALL your order in.  If you just SHOW UP and order take out, then you will be waiting and waiting--not because they are slow, because they are the most popular asian restaurant around and their food is awesome!

Every time we call this place.. they have to decide if they want to deliver? And thus now, "your food sucks". Is there a Negative star rating? Dwarf star rating scale perhaps? Something where due to it's sucking so bad, it's choking on it's own gravitational weight and collapses in on it's self in a fantastically mediocre fashion?

All of the food is delicious. From The curry to the sushi. The prices are right. Sometimes the service is a bit slow when it's gets really busy. King is such an over achiever!!!! Arminio the delivery driver is always on top of things!

Went in today for lunch with my mom and sister. We each had the lunch special which is about $7.50 each. The portions are decent sized and taste freshly made. We had the chicken noodle soup which tastes really good! Will definitely be back again. The man at the bar helped us and he was very friendly.
Went in for a few drinks and apps and all the sushi rolls and crab puffs were awesome. Arvand, the Bartender, was very suggestive and very knowledgeable about all the food and drinks... Kudos!

Everything tastes old and reheated. Chewy rice, egg rolls that tasted like the same ones I was served in the cafeteria in junior high. Chow mein was bland and sweet and sour chicken tasted like the kind you buy in the frozen section. Will not be ordering there again.
I still enjoy going here from time to time but the food quality has gone down significantly. So much that I had to bring a to oh order back because the food wasn't even cooked!

This is by far the best Chinese Food I have EVER had! The food is spectacular, I go there all the time! I usually get the Tangerine Chicken, the Hong Kong style chowmein, potstickers, egg rolls, and lettuce wraps! All these are amazing and this is a fantastic restaurant! I also get delivery and it is very fast (the food is still hot and delicious!)

I can't say I agree that the food is good. This was the first time we tried this place. The cost versus the quality doesn't match up. Can't say I'll ever order from here again. And the people on the phone seemed confused at best. I was on hold for 3 minutes and never told how long my food would take. Very disappointed.

Needed some soup last night due to cold picked up in lovely Phoenix. Ordered the chicken noodle soup and while the broth and noodles was good and the broccoli in the soup was an unusual touch, the white meat chicken that was floating was unappetizing, slimy and of poor quality. Also tried the szucheun chicken with string beans and I ordered it non-spicy. It did come out non-spicy, but also was non-tasting. It was just loaded with a sticky brown sauce that had no taste at all. The string beans were fresh though and the owner was a nice guy. They also had a live band playing on Friday night which I guess is unusual for a Chinese joint. It was just a cover band, but still a nice touch.

Shout out to JJ who handled customer service as a professional. I may have been disappointed by my last encounter with Autumn Court, but today more than makes up for it. If you are looking for great Chinese food, look no further.

This food is so amazing, we go in or order take out at least 2 times a week, the bar usually has the best service, but that's only because they are not staffed right for dinning in guests, but the atmosphere is very relaxing and quiet, the music playing in the background is just perfect, it's dim during the evening and sunny and beautiful during the day in the inside. We love, love going there, and it is truley Fabulous!!!

I have never gotten take out from this place and have eaten in only a few times. The food is nothing special but it's not bad either. The service is good, so friendly and they kept checking in on us to make sure everything was ok and see if we needed anything. It's not my first choice I will be honest (however, one of my favorite Chinese places is down the street so to be fair they have some pretty steep competition in the neighborhood) but it is pretty good none-the-less.

I wanted to try a new Chinese place, and where I live there aren't many options that deliver.  I went with the Orange Peel Chicken and Crab Puffs.  $18 and change for the order.  The chicken tasted as though it were microwaved and was very soggy.  The crab puffs had absolutely no crab or even the flavor of it.  I ate the food and became very sick within 20 minutes of finishing.  Thank goodness I was working from home this day.  I will not be ordering from this place ever again.  Too bad...I was really hoping to find a good Chinese delivery place in the 85250 area.

Went here because I had been to its old location on central before the fire and was really impressed. I think it was a buffet on central but cant swear to it. Anyways, thought I'd give them a try on their new indian school location. Ordered the lunch specials on take out which are typically $5-$7. This place was $7.50 and dollar more for shrimp but figured no worry, it's great quality and maybe they will give bigger portions. I call them up to place the takeout order and I tell them I want fried rice. They say that will be $1 extra. Right then I should have hung up and said have a good day but I said ok just give me white then. I get there and they have the food ready and the man who takes my card and gives me my food is very nice. However the portions were way too small and the food only average. I should have gone to another restaurant, probably could have paid less and got just as much if not more. And certainly wouldnt have had to have paid extra for fried rice.  I am sorry but dont see myself coming back anytime soon.
Happy hr all day Sunday great food love the bartenders. Try Todd fry rice. Mai tai and sushi.

This was the worst Chinese food I have ever had.  Went there for lunch and a friend had the sesame chicken and I had the orange chicken.  Not sure what previous reviewer was talking about with large portions or quality.  Received 10 very small pieces of breaded chicken with a horrible sauce a scoop of white rice and soy sauced pan fried noodles.  There was no one in the restaurant and we now know why.   I Would never eat there again or recommend it to anyone.

The food was terrible my rice was burnt for the rice soup asked for extra chicken i didnt get it the staff was rude waited like 20 minutes for a plate of food by the time everyone else finished eating i started oh heres an idea turn the ac on will not recommend this place to anyone

I was looking for a new lunch spot so tried this place out. Below average service, below average food and they charge $2.50 for hot tea. Do yourself a favor and go a few blocks down the street to Desert Jade.
Came in for Lunch, was greeted right away! Sat that the bar. Great local beer selection. Ordered the sweet and sour chicken and was not disappointed. Service was great. I would highly recommend!

Tried the scallops with black bean sauce; very good with the green peppers; would probably ask for onions to be added.  Also, tried sweet & sour chicken; very good homemade sauce.  Also, had the Egg Foo Yung, which was very good as usual.
I placed an order online. I would suggest calling instead. It took an hour and a half from start to finish, because they weren't aware that it had been placed. Food was ok.

I've been passing this place for years and that was a big mistake.  I went in with my mom and sister for lunch. It was empty, so that was kind of unassuring. But once we sat down our server came up to us and was very nice! He explained the spicyness of the dishes and let us know we could taper it down.   We were able to order off the lunch menu. The sesame chicken was great. My sister got the sweet and sour chicken which was excellent. Mom got the tofu. She liked it too. The portions were huge! I didn't expect to get that much food. The prices? Very reasonable! $7.50 for lunch? Can't beat that.   The place was very clean and the service was great.   I will definitely come back!

I love this place!  I live down the street, so it's very convenient, but I would stop by even if it wasn't so close.  The owner is always so friendly and makes us feel very welcome.  The food is probably my favorite Chinese food in the Valley.  I typically don't like Chinese food, as it always seems to be fried chicken suspended in some kind of bizarre gelatin concoction (P.F. Chang's, Pei Wei, Panda Express, etc.), but this place has fresh vegetables, good meat, and excellent spices.  Ask for your dish SPICY, and make sure to get the egg rolls!

It's not bad.  I mean we do eat there when we just want a quick grab that is near home.  But I havent really gotten anything that I have fallen in love with, and I think that it is a bit pricey for what the food is.  But the staff is really nice.  And food is really quick.

Absolutely terrible service. Ordered take out, showed up at the time they told us it would be ready. Sat at the bar for 20 minutes without a server or bartender asking us if we wanted a drink or talking to us at all. Over an hour after our food was supposed to be ready, the guy, supposedly the owner, comes up and hands us the bill. It was very overpriced. He didn't apologize and didn't explain why it took almost TWO HOURS to make 4 people's take out Chinese food.  The food was also terrible quality. On a scale of 1-10, 10 being the best, I'd give it a three at most. I had beef chop suey that had very little flavor, and my brothers both had chicken chow mein that had almost no noodles in them.  The staff was inconsiderate and there was no excuse for their tardiness, as there was maybe 5 other patrons in the restaurant.  There are many other good Chinese/Asian restaurants in the area, and needless to say, I will not be coming here again.

Haven't dined here in way over a year until last night. Had a fabulous experience sitting at the bar.  Didn't catch the servers name but he was awesome! Had a bunch of sushi rolls on happy hour and shrimp with lobster sauce as an entree. Was very pleased. Definitely great Arcadia Chinese restaurant.

I've been to autumn court a few times, and officially hooked! Their happy hour specials are an incredible/easy deal to take advantage of, they have a nice clean restaurant with a fine ambiance. Their soundtrack is really nice, and they have a nice/fun waitstaff! Arvand is a fantastic bartender, and I would definitely recommend coming in!

First time here and wanted authentic Chinese food which looks promising and they have us a coupon for our food taking longer! Very thoughtful, appreciate the kindness. The family restaurant is awesome and love the culture.

I should have known not to dine here when I waited 10 minutes for someone to greet me and in that time saw two customers give up on waiting for the takeout food they had ordered. For some reason, I went through with being seated. The waitress had to turn on the lights by my table as if they were desperately trying to save money. The table was dirty and she took forever to come back just with water and menus, so I left. Don't bother trying this place!

This place is not very good.  I like their sesame chicken about 30% of the time - very inconsistent!  Everything else I've tried are ok or nasty..  My coworker found a bit of a bug in the plastic wrapping they used to wrap the container.  Would not eat there..
Unfortunately I've never eaten here I deliver for ubereats and I've had several several orders coming out of here the food is supposed to be especially good I will come back someday to try my own

This has always been my go-to Chinese takeout! The last time I ordered vegetable low mein, it had too many what I like to call "fillers" with big chunks of onion and cabbage when really, I want my noodles! Then again it is veggie based! That's why I order low mein because I love the noodles! There was barely any the last time I ordered. Of the two meat dishes we ordered, again, barely any meat. The beef and broccoli was mostly broccoli which is great but where's the beef?! I hate it when there's loads of onions, lettuce, bean sprouts (aka: filler) and not enough meat or noodles or what you truly want when you order. Autumn Court has always been my go-to for takeout Chinese because I find it healthier and not as greasy as some others, however, they need to provide more of the base of the meal. Still my favorite in Phx

Average at best:  service & food. I tried multiple times and dined in main dining area not at the bar.   I use to go to their original location before this location & it was much better then.  I wish this location could've worked out since I now work within walking distance to it but sadly I have to pick another and travel further.   Apparently their happy hour & sushi has received rave reviews but I can't bare to try it if they can't do a simple Kung Pao dish when it is a Chinese/Asian restaurant. I did try their 'tempura' shrimp & vegetables but it was overly thick in breading & not very tasty. I did ask for other recommendations from the server that could be spicier & less sweet; but alas, all main entrees were too sweet that I've tried.    Again, these are my personal tastebuds & I may be a little more particular since I'm half-Asian. And some diners prefer sweeter entrees & if you do then this is the place for you.

This place is trash. Garbage. Not only the food but the service. I had servers walk by me and ignore as I waited for pick up and the food was horrendous. Get new cooks and staff. Asap. Bad for business.

Nice service and ambiance, but the food just isn't very good (soups being the exception.) We had lunch there, I had the eggplant with chicken, the only flavor was "salt" - no spice, no flavors like ginger, garlic etc. Just lots and lots of soy sauce. The eggroll was kind of cold and greasy. The iced tea tasted a bit funky (like the container needed a good scrubbing.) The hot & sour soup was quite good.
Ordered food through Grub Hub that was not delivered with an excuse of "we had a false delivery message sent" and Autumn Court's only response is "call Grub Hub".

I must be missing something when it says that it's the best in Phoenix.  I ordered the sweet and sour chicken dinner, and really wasn't all that impressed.  It started with egg drop soup, which is just egg drop soup - you can't really do anything unique there. Next was the egg roll, the same egg roll I've had at a dozen other Chinese places, so no surprise there.  The chicken was disappointing - there was technically chicken on the plate, and some of it was fried, but there really wasn't any flavor on the plate at all. The meat was bland, the pineapples, tomatoes, onions, and peppers didn't seem quite right, and the sweet and sour sauce itself didn't have any panache.  It's not terribly expensive, but I still can definitely do better for a few bucks less.

I love this restaurant and I love their customer service.  I ordered takeout and I ordered it through one of their vendors.  The vendor came late with my food but the owner called me to make sure that I got my food.  He even followed up with me the next day. He was so friendly and so professional and the food was delicious. If you are going to order takeout I would definitely do it here but please go through the website instead of eat 24. Yummy!

Grossest Chinese food I've ever had. I ordered the PuPu Platter last night and all the appetizers were overcooked. (The egg rolls were almost burnt). I also ordered teriyaki chicken. It looked like no teriyaki chicken I've ever seen. The chicken wasn't pre-marinated and had a sauce the consistency of water that stank. I couldn't eat it. Hugely disappointed and wast of $30 (including delivery fee, tax, tip, etc).
Amazing place! Great service and they have some of the best food! Love the big bowl of hot and sour soup. The portions are huge! Great prices. Couldn't be happier with this place.

We hadn't been to Autumn Court since they moved locations from Central Avenue, so obviously a long time ago!  We decided to stop in for dinner last night and had a good experience.  Friendly staff, nice atmosphere and tasty food.  Just for checking in we received a free fried wonton appetizer - nice!  I ordered the beef with string beans and really enjoyed it...so yummy, but quite salty.  The portion was so big that I was unable to eat it all, so brought it home for lunch some day this weekend.

this was the worst excuse or chinese food i have ever tasted i meen you flat out ripped me off the pupu for 2 was a total joke the beef sticks that came with it i wouldnt feed my dog i meen how could u even send that out and feel right about it never again yuck!!!

This place is just A-OK!  I have been there twice, the first time I had the sushi, which was not bad if you are in a pinch for sushi and the second time I had their lunch special which was pretty good.  The portion for lunch looks small but is surprisingly enough when you are finished eating.  The service can get a little better but other than that it gets 3 stars in my book!

What type of established business doesn't answer their business line during business hours. I called twice to place an order for delivery and they don't answer. Well that means they lost business, sad customer service.

High quality food, no mystery meat here!  Super quick service too...I go for lunch very often and I always half my food in 10 minutes or less....less time than it takes to write this Yelp review.  Great lunch specials, very affordable prices, very cool location, nice bar, and they even have some pretty fancy music.  Some days it sounds like I walked into a spa and I'm waiting to get my massage and some days it sounds like I'm in a chinese club.  I'm not complaining, it's just kind of amusing.  But back to the food!  Love the fried rice and egg drop soup and their kung pao chicken is the best I've found in the Phoenix area.  You can't go wrong with this place.
The house fried rice and happy hour drink specials are a favorite!   The king pao is yummy!    This is a local,casual spot.  I would not recommend it for a business meeting or first date.

Pros:  I was looking for a central Phoenix Chinese place that was open late (check).  The staff were very friendly, both on the phone and in person.  My meal was ready fast.  Cons:  The potstickers were so-so, two of them were burned on the bottom.  The walnut shrimp had very little sauce on it (which was OK, it wasn't great) and only included three pieces of broccoli.  The texture of the shrimp was a little mealy, like they'd previously been frozen.  I ended up not eating most of this dish.
These guys are consistently good. This is not fine dining folks. This edible, delicious delivery with an in-house pleasant bar-tender slash to go order taker with a drink if you're so inclined.
Awesome! I love the Pepper Steak and crab puffs!

You walk in and wonder if you are in the right place.... Kind of shabby looking.    But the food does not disappoint.  Full bar and decent sushi, lots of Chinese restaurant dishes.  Try the duck!    Service was excellent - See you again, AC!

Here's the deal - I am reviewing on happy hour only; unfortunately, I've never eaten here another time, my wife just isn't a chinese food fan ever...  But for happy hour, I'm often here just for the happy hour bar menu.  They have a crunchy roll that is the best sushi roll you will ever touch your tongue to.  Pile on some dumplings and edamame, and you have one of the best dinner deals in town.  Anytime I can find somebody to hit Autumn Court between 3-7pm, I'm there.  And I could eat that crunchy roll 7 days a week.
Chinese food that delivers, it's hot when it arrives, tastes authentic and is reasonably prices.   Yup.   I'm a regular orderer!

We visited Autumn Court to celebrate my wife's birthday,  with two other couples. They were not very busy and we were seated immediately. I ordered Schezwan Pork and my wife ordered Lemon Chicken, with fried rice. The vegetables in my  pork dish were quite overdone and soft, almost mushy. My wife's Lemon Chicken was very flavorful and enjoyable (yes, she gave me a nice sample). We shared the fried rice and it was very good. Oh, I also had egg drop soup which was more broth than egg drop. I wouldn't recommend the soup. Even though the Lemon Chicken was good, I probably wouldn't go back to Autumn Court.

The food here is tasty and affordable. I disagree with the reviews that say dinner is a little spendy roughly $13.50 for some kind of meat, white rice, soup, and an eggroll or crabpuff. AND it's enough for two meals. The lunch specials seem like awesome deals and we'll be back for those sooner rather than later! There's a lot to try on the menu.   The food is good. It's what I expected. I had the spicy orange chicken. The flavor was spot on. My only two suggestions would be crispier chicken & more sauce. However, that may be a personal preference so I am going to just ask for it next time. My boyfriend had broccoli beef and loved it. Haven't tried our egg rolls yet as they're in the fridge as leftovers ;)   I'm confused on the reviews that say the service isn't good here. I didn't experience that at all. My boyfriend and I were here on Friday night for a late dinner (9 PM) and we did not feel like burdens AT ALL. The owner even came and had a quick chat with us about the area and Phoenix weather. The servers were friendly and answered all of our questions. I'm not sure what you could ask for?!  P.S. They take your food from you to box it up. They also gave fresh rice with each takeout container with hot mustard, spicy chili sauce, and sweet & sour in containers. I have a true appreciation for this!!!! We will be back! They deserve more than a 3 star review.

Not the best Chinese food I've ever had, yet not the worst either.  I ordered food for delivery after viewing their menu online.  Their website is not very sophisticated, and difficult to navigate.  I was unable to find their phone number on their website so I had to google them to get a phone number in order to call in my order.  The gentleman who took my order was very helpful and polite.  The food arrived in a timely matter, and was still hot.  I will definitely be giving them another try.

I was skeptical because of some recent reviews, but they mostly seemed to be around the topic of their delivery service and that's not what we were planning. We ordered a large order of wonton soup, crab puffs & an order of spicy orange chicken. It was all really delicious. The only reason for less than 5 stars is because it's not a (what I would consider) "normal" wonton soup & had lots of bok choy-the flavor was still amazing, but I would have asked for it without it if it had been listed on the menu.  Also, I liked the chicken, but the sauce was still a little too sweet for my taste...especially for being spicy orange chicken.  The crab puffs were amazing & the service was fast! I feel every home needs a go to easy Chinese restaurant & if the good food & service continues, this will be ours!
Yuck!  Yet another proof point in my ever strengthening argument that this town lacks good Chinese food.  But, they deliver, and in my neighborhood that counts for something.

After reading the other reviews I'm completely confused with the negative comments. This place is amazing. We always order take out from here and the food couldn't be tastier! Never had a bad experience and will continue eating at this little gem!

So, this place delivers soup...and soup is good when your sick, and the portions are large, I also went ahead and got my regular crab puffs and orange chicken. Simply delicious a definite improvement since the last time I ordered. The chicken still could of been a little more juicy but for the most part I would say this place has improved on the quality of food since the last time I ate there. The crab puffs were fat filled with cream cheese the crab still seemed to be lacking a bit, but definitely better then before. The service was as good as it could of been for delivery. I would say more like 3.5 stars. But I am feeling frisky today so I am going to give it 4 stars.

This place would have got a solid 5 stars, except for two reasons:  1.) I placed an order with Katie for a group lunch at work. I specifically ordered the G combo, which comes with plenty of appetizers, lo mein, and teriyaki chicken served over fried rice. When the delivery guy dropped it off, it was Kung Pao chicken... filled with hot peppers and peanuts. All I kept thinking: half of the staff are allergic to peanuts, and the other half can't eat anything past a bell pepper.   2.) Katie wasn't pleasant and I found myself not wanting to give business to a company who has a snob answering their phone.  Nevertheless, the flavors and authenticity of the food was fantastic. The delivery guy was very apologetic for the mishap and said the owner would be contacting me on Monday. If they correct and/or apologize for the mistake, our company will definitely order from them again.

One of the best Chinese restaurants I have been to in Phoenix. I have gone here twice now and it hasn't disappointed. The teriyaki chicken with broccoli was good even when I took it to go, and the spicy orange chicken while not very spicy, was still prepared very well. The upgrade for fried rice is definitely worth it!

This place is clean and the food is good enough. That being said the atmosphere of the employees yelling at each other in the back room and the service is horrible. The potstickers taste like jimmy dean breakfast sausage wrapped in wontons and cooked to a crispy cracker like finish. No need to try this again.

I come here and the food is always on point. The staff can be a little shaky at times but the food is awesome. I usually get the shrimp fried rice with the hot and sour soup and mix them. I also had the king pao chicken and it's really good. Good atmosphere and good prices.

I've only been once for lunch, but thought it was pretty good Chinese for Phoenix.  The service was also excellent on my visit and I didn't have to wait for a table or wait a long time to be served (as someone else did).

Hey there last month the food was okay nothing great but nothing bad either.  It's a decent place to stop and have lunch.  I saw a lot of people around the bar drinking too so it seems kind of a hangout for others

Really tasty food.  Very good service.  This place is an asset to the neighborhood.  I'm just mad at myself for not going earlier.  Very reasonable prices.  I'm looking forward to trying more items from the menu here.

I've ordered delivery through Uber Eats from here in the past and it was perfect. They offer a lot of food for the price and everything tasted great. I ordered recently however and didn't end up with the fried wonton that I ordered (which is $5 by the way). So I called and all I wanted to know was whether they forgot to put it in my bag or if uber lost it somehow. The guy who answered asked me if I was calling him a liar and then hung up on me. It was the rudest phone call ever. I called back and asked if the manager was around and the same guy answered and said "no the manager isn't around why do you think I'd be able to talk to you like this?" I honestly was in shock. I sent a simple message to UberEATS and was refunded the money within hours but I will never ever order from this place ever again. The food isn't worth the disrespectful "service" that I received.

Sushi at a Chinese restaurant?  I wasn't brave enough to try it, but I was impressed that there was a decent sized sushi menu offered to me...   I ordered 'carry-out' a couple of times from Autumn Court and had decent meals, so tonight I decided to get the full experience and eat in the restaurant.  The hostess (who turned out to be my waitress as well) was attentive.  Not the friendliest, but she was fine.  I guess I would've liked to see her smile, but aside from that, service was perfectly attentive.  Several other people checked on me as well (I assume the GM or owner).  I went with the egg flower soup to start and the mixed vegetable with tofu dish.  The soup was kind of bland.  I thought about sending it back, but I added a little soy sauce and kept my mouth shut... The entree was delicious... the tofu was golden brown and the perfect texture and the veggies were crisp and delicious.    I will order carry-out and even return to dine-in at Autumn Court again... maybe next time I'll even get a smile!

So after yesterday's horrendous Chinese food fiasco at Chop & Wok, my Chinese food craving still had not been sated. One of my *insert social networking site here* buddies suggested I try this place. He swears by it. So I got home, ready to sit down to a bowl of my spicy vegetable stew, when I get a wild hare (hair??).... Whatever. I get the urge for Chinese food. So I call these guys up for some delivery (I had just put on my pj's and fuzzy slippers...that's the international code for 'Tyger will NOT be leaving the building'.) Anyway, I ordered the Singapore Noodles and crab puffs. The delivery guy showed up about 20 minutes later. Alright Autumn Court, you are on my good side, and you now have my full attention. I open up the paper bag holding my nummy morsels. And the heavens opened up, a golden light poured out, angels sang halleluia, I think I may have gotten chills...inside that brown paper sack, the staff of Autumn Court had individually wrapped every single spillable item securely in plastic wrap. I was so happy I could've humped his leg, right then and there. The food was fresh and well prepared, the shrimp was large and in charge, not much seasoning on it as it's a delicately flavored dish, but still very tasty. The crab rangoon...um...crab puffs were yummy and crispy, not bloated or soggy (see review of Chop & Wok) I will definitely order from Autumn Court again! Yay! Hooray for delicious Chinese delivery in my 'hood!!

Omer, I'm sorry you had a bad experience at Autumn Court, I go about once every two weeks, and in the ten or more times I have gone I only experienced bad service once. I completely agree on the decor, Autumn Court relocated from their original location and the place they moved into looks a bit "Bill Johnson's"  The reason I return is the food. I generally navigate to the Dan-Dan noodles, for lunch the servings are a good price, with plenty of quality and quantity. I tried the Sushi once and came away unimpressed.  In summary, not a bad lunchtime Chinese place

my favorite chinese place. ordered delivery. it got here super fast and was fresh. weird fried wontons, but in a good way. the paper chicken is also very good. I got the sesame chicken as my entree. I appreciate how they package the chicken separately from the sauce so it doesn't get soggy in transport. huge portion sizes. great taste. definitely worth the price.

This place is so disgusting my dog wouldn't even eat it. $38 for 3 entree takeout? No wonder why the place is dead on Friday night. Sweet & sour shrimp in separate bowls? Cold White rice stuck together in a huge cube? Cmon. I'm tempted to drive back and get a refund. I mean, who even runs this place and checks the food?? DM me.  Never going back...never.

I ordered three egg rolls and the sweet and sour chicken with fried rice. I could barely eat one because it was so doughey, unflavored and had hardly any filling. The sweet and sour chicken isn't bad, but I'd much rather have ordered from pho Tempe.... and their ratings are worse! However, their food is much better.

I am editing my review because I am impressed with Autumn Court's customer service. I wrote my original review not expecting a response, and I believe that service is a huge part of what deserves a good rating.   I ordered lunch for myself and 6 other employees through Bitesquad for a lunch meeting. Two of the orders came in not as we expected, as they were both Chow Mein dishes but arrived with no Chow Mein noodles. After hearing from Autumn Court, one of the orders was made correctly by the restaurant but was ordered incorrectly due to our misunderstanding of the menu. The other order was incorrect but seems to be an honest mistake from the restaurant and things like this happen to even the most attentive establishments.  The members who received what they were expecting loved their food. We definitely recommend the crab puffs as they were crispy, seasoned well, and gone within seconds. The pot stickers were large and meaty. The member who ordered the Dan Dan noodles said they were delicious and had great texture, and even the noodle-less Spicy Beef Chow Mein dish had amazing flavor. Another honorable mention was that the order was made and delivered perfectly on time even though there were 7 of us (shoutout to both the restaurant and Bitesquad)  I will have to give this place another chance. Please note that I did NOT receive free items to update my review, and I updated it because I genuinely feel as though my first rating was unfair.

Autumn Court personally reached out via Yelp after my review and apologized for the mishap. JJ then personally called me and apologized and made sure Autumn Court took care of us. Thanks to him we enjoyed a meal on the house and we're so glad this restaurant did everything in their power to our win trust back. Autumn Court has always been our favorite and I'm glad to stay they still are especially after the great service we received. Thanks again!
Prices are reasonable.  Food is fresh and service is always good.   Its the best Asian Fusion restaurant in the area.  John

Never, never, never going here again...  Hearing complaining about tips is a HUGE turn off in my book. Upon entering Autumn Court the server/bartender was complaining to a man sitting at the bar that the last customers that she served did not leave her a tip. (To be honest, I would have considered stiffing her too after these comments.) She then had the audacity to ask the customer if she should go out and ask them for one! This is all while we were waiting to be seated. The customer said "I wouldn't" and she made a dash for the side door heading to the parking lot. The customer turned to us and said he had never seen anything like that before. Wait...there's more. We turned around and left to find a different place to eat and I made a call to the manager to let him know what had happened. He listened, but offered no resolution and took my information to pass to the owner. Five minutes later my cell phone starts ringing and it is the server (seriously!?) we called about asking why we thought it was not right that she did that and told me that she had the RIGHT to tips because she was not paid hourly. I briefly spoke to her about the rudeness of speaking to customers about other customers and all she could say was that she would not get fired over this. Babe, if were my restaurant you would have totally have been gone for this. Tomorrow I'll try and contact the owner direct because we are never going there again and my phone number should not have been passed out like that. Time to find another neighborhood Chinese restaurant.

Just called and placed a delivery order and was told it's to late for delivery. Okay thinking to myself I asked "what time do you deliver till" the man said "9:15" . I looked at the time and it was 9:00. I said this to him and his response was "it's just too late we are busy and hungup". What horrible service. He could have said I'm so sorry we are unable to at the moment instead of saying it's too late and hanging up.
Everything here is good.  The hot and sour soup and sesame chicken are my two favorites.  The delivery is always fast and food is hot.  Really nice staff as well.

I'm not a very adventurous person when it comes to food.  I will never surprise you and get something different when going to a familiar haunt.  So when the hubby suggested Autumn Court I was a little reluctant.    We venture out and are seated right away.  I immediately notice the cologne on the gentleman seating us.  Turns out he will also be our waiter.  J ordered the sizzling rice soup, we shared an order of BBQ pork and potstickers and I ordered the brocolli beef.  BBQ pork was done perfectly it is/was AMAZING.  J loved his soup.  It was filled with chicken and shrimp and tons of veggies.  He loaded it up with chili paste and a dash or two of soy sauce and I didn't hear a peep out of him for a good ten minutes while he enjoyed.    It's good.  Real good.  My beef was good.  I love veggies and the brocolli was perfect.

So to start with, I did order delivery and it went off without a hitch. So let's get to the good stuff. The food.  I ordered the crispy aromatic duck, with fried rice, egg roll, and egg drop soup. To be honest, I wasn't expecting much because I haven't found much in the way of good Chinese food in Phoenix so far. But I was pleasantly surprised by this!  The food is wonderful, truly. Everything was so flavorful, there wasn't need for salt or pepper. My favorite is probably the soup and I think next time I'll order more of it. The fried rice is delicious and not overdone which is even better. The egg roll is lovely and extra crispy. The duck was the best, I've never had better. So rich, I was sad when I was full!   I can't recommend this place enough. I'll be ordering from this restaurant for my Chinese food cravings from now on.

Food was horrible! Ordered ToGo, Crab Puffs were very very salty, cream cheese is supposed to be sweet, also couldn't find or taste any crab. Sesame chicken was poor, fried with sauce on the side in a container and boy did the sauce make me wanna gag. Will never order food from here again.

My girlfriend and I were excited to try this place, we got the house style chow Mein with an order or fried rice and an order of spicy orange chicken. I work late so I got it to go. It took a few minutes for somebody to notice I was there but finally the bartender noticed and got somebody to get my order. Once the staff brought out my food they were nice. They wrapped up everything well and I liked that they put the sauce for the orange chicken on the side. Once we ate we thought the chow Mein was decent and the fried rice was good. The only major gripe that I have is about the spicy orange chicken. I really wouldn't even call it chicken. It just seemed like tiny pieces of breading fried. Idk about you guys but when I order orange chicken anywhere else it comes as nice full pieces. I had to throw away over half of it because we weren't going to eating breading. Very disappointed in this order and I doubt that we will be coming back.

My first real review: WORST DELIVERY EVER!!!! 2 hours later and the kid picking up the phone at the restaurant when I called to check on my order TWICE all he can say was its in its way and they're really busy... Well keep up the crappy delivery times and you'll have lots of free time on your hands soon enough!  Not mention food was cold and not worth it.
Pretty standard American Chinese food, not anything special, but still good. The online ordering system is nice though.

While our waiter was a doll, thats the only good comment I have for this place.  I ordered an egg roll, potstickers, and crab puffs from their happy hour menu. Super cheap, and it showed in the quality of the food. The egg roll was burnt on the outside and soggy on the inside, ew. The potstickers were basically balls of sausage in a pasta pocket, and the crab puffs....didnt have any crab in them, real or imitation. It was just a wonton and cream cheese. My friend (who's a vegatarian and has never had a crab puff) told me "Yeah theres no meat in them, isnt that great! The only reason crab is in the title is cuz theyre shaped like crabs." Oh poor misguided girl...  I wouldnt recommend this place to anyone.

This restaurant has the feel and atmosphere of a nice family restaurant. Service is outstanding and our server was very attentive. I ordered the szechuan chicken and my friend got chicken broccoli. The means were decent, flavorful and appetizing. The portion on the szechuan chicken was smaller than the chicken broccoli. Other than that we enjoyed our meals and had a good time.

The food has always been good here and the prices are very reasonable but the service has always been awkward.  Kind of hard to describe but it seems like no one who works here has ever worked as a server.  Friendly and always nice we have never had a bad experience, just awkward.    There is the older Asian gentleman who I believe is a manger or owner who appears to be little more than a nuisance to the servers and the guest.  Once we where told that during their happy hour, we would have to go to the bar ourselves and order drinks since happy hour was just in the bar.  Mind you, the place surrounds an open bar which was about 10 feet from our booth.  I will continue to go there since the food is great for the price but don't expect much from their staff and you will be fine.  Again not rude and very friendly just weird and awkward.

I hate leaving negative reviews and I'm all for family businesses but I feel it's necessary.    Starting with drinks I asked for water with lemon and I received 1/4 of a lemon wedge that consisted of 80% peel and very little actual citrus. I hate it when restaurants try to save a few pennies by being cheap and skimping on the smaller details.   My hot and sour soup was watered down consisting of two strings of vegetables and cube of tofu and was rather vinegary.   Ordered sweet and sour chicken and the orange chicken and crunch rolls. I favored the sweet and sour chicken over the Orange. The food was not the best but pretty good.  About fifteen minutes into our meal I see a cockroach making its way across the table next to my 1yr old daughter's plate. I freak out immediately and pick up my daughter and get up from the table. I was immediately done and ready to leave.  Food was good but i don't think I could find it in me to make another trip back

Positive: The food! We had soup, chow fun, and the Peking duck. The chow fun was exactly like at home. The Peking duck  was served exactly how my sister liked (lean, less fat). Also, great service. My sister and I felt incredibly homesick after eating here.   Negative: I wish the Peking duck was served on a bao instead of in the wrappers; however, my sister informs me that the wrappers are more traditional.

So.. I have to say service here is just great. I was very upset that for the 2nd time I got home and my order was not correct. We come here often and this being the 2nd time takeout mistake and about 3rd time. And all I ask is for no mushrooms or meat. So it's a simple request. So I called. They transferred me to the manager and he said what should it be we will make it again and bring it to you. Wow service. Although he should have got it right the first time and being this happens all the time here I lowered the review to 4 stars. But not because the food isn't good its just they need to make sure they listen and double check. I'm happy in the end but wish it was right to start because that would make them flawless
Not really memorable but, good dependable Chinese food. I like the space too.
General Tso chicken is DELICIOUS!! Cashew chicken is pretty good, the veggies in it are fresh for sure! No complaints here!

I wasn't expecting too much from reading the reviews but I tried to stay objective!
