We came for a friends birthday and there isn't that much room for larger parties, so four of us had to sit in a booth isolated from the rest of the party (awkwarrrrd)   I just think that the portions are average and the food is really expensive. It wasn't anything that was exceptional so I was kind of surprised that a plate of shrimp was $15. I was a little bit let down. Will I give this place another chance? Maybe; it just depends on if I'm on that side of town but most likely not. There are plenty of other Chinese restaurants that serve quality food for less than this place.
Excellent customer service every single time! Great ambiance! Great prices! The best in the Arcadia area!!

I've used them twice this week for lunch meetings, and both times it's been excellent! We got a LOT of food for what we paid, delivery has been on time, they've made sure we have any needed serving utensils, and they've called both days in the afternoon to follow up to make sure everything went well.  I will use them again and recommend them highly.

Went away for Thanksgiving and all the places serving thanksgiving were $70+. Not being big turkey fans we broke tradition and came here. Best Chinese we had in years!!  Great food, fresh and superb service. Very glad we came here instead of turkey any day!!

First one star review in awhile.  Got takeout last night and service was good but all three dishes were inedible due to oversalting. It was as if they mistook salt for sugar or something.  The mapo tofu was the worst followed by the sauce on the braised eggplant.  The Mongolian beef was the best off at just plain salty.  I usually like food saltier but this was horrific.  We threw it out.  One and done for me.  Stay away!

Pretty good Chinese food - like what I'm used to from the East Coast (NYC).  The wonton soup was very flavorful with fresh bits of green onion and celery.  The Singapore noodles were flavorful with several large shrimp and tender pieces of port.  And the kung pow chicken had a nice flavor with some whole black beans in the sauce.  Everything was tasty, not greasy/oily, nor too salty.  Atmosphere and service were fine.  I'd definitely go back on my next trip to Scottsdale.

Just moved to Phoenix and was looking for a good Teriyaki place, this was close by so I figured I'd give it a shot. The inside of the establishment looks nice although it has a kind of "Applebee's meets Asian" vibe. The food was unfortunately was mediocre at best: my teriyaki chicken was a bit boring with no real flavor on the chicken and a lackluster sauce. The rice was hard and flavorless (it was white rice so I wasn't expecting much, but still) and the broccoli was fairly tasteless. The fried wontons were a bit bland but did have a very nice crunch. The biggest disappointment was that I asked for a lemonade and got some gross tasting water with the slightest hint of citrus. I thought that maybe I had been misheard and maybe he had just given me some lemon water, but lo and behold I got charged the full 2.50 for it. Overall, it wasn't the worst, but it definitely wasn't special.

Terrible. Go to King Wongs up the street much better service and food. Not as nice on the inside but food is edible. Told the long haired bartender I wasn't happy with the food and he said 'sorry to Hear that' and didn't even try to remedy the situation. Autumn Court, #notevenonce
Love this place. The owner is very friendly and food is good. Be sure to check out their happy hour sushi menu 'cause it's inexpensive!  The crunchy roll is my favorite.

Ugh. In a word, gross. Don't waste your money or your time. We got takeout here and had the sechuan beef, chicken low mein, egg rolls, and the sizzling soup. Pretty much none of it was edible. In fact, we threw it out after a few bites. Super greasy, and not a lot of flavor and frankly, I'm a bit shocked by the positive reviews here.   I don't want to sound like a jerk, but I will never eat here again.

I absolutely LOVE Autumn Court, it is my go-to chinese take-out/delivery restaurant. Not just because it is only a block or two away from my home, but because it is the best. The food is delicious and pretty inexpensive, the portions are also very generous. We are addicted to he general Tso's chicken, and for $20 for two orders of it along with two containers of rice, it's enough to feed two and have enough leftover for another meal. Two of my other favorites are the honey crisp chicken and the orange peel chicken. The service is usually very fast for pickup it's usually ready in 15-20 mins and delivery no more than 30 mins(unless you order delivery on a sat/sun night then it can be an hour and a half  to two hours wait). Another bonus of getting takeout/delivery from here is that the entrees come in these reusable, microwavable containers, I order from here so often that I never have to buy tupperware lol.
I have it delivered often. My boyfriend and I enjoy eating here. Great portions always hot being delivered.
Ordered delivery. Was quoted 30-45 min. Driver showed up an hour 20 with someone else's cold order bummerrrrr.
2  hour wait and then canceled my order. Go to little Shanghai down the street. Real service there.

J and I were in the mood for Chinese Saturday night.  We decide to get takeout from Autumn Court.    J calls in the order.  I ordered the Lemon Chicken (a chef specialty apparently) and J ordered the Pepper Steak.  J also gets an order of pot stickers and we get a couple egg rolls. He's told that it will be ready in 10 minutes.  Talk about fast.  Maybe too fast?    I get there and the restaurant is completely empty.  For 7:30 on a Saturday night, that raises a reddish flag for me.  I get our food, pay - it comes to $31, and head on home.  When I get home we strip off the 2 ft of saran wrap off our dinner boxes and dig in.  My lemon chicken was super soggy.  Like it had been cooked and them steamed (maybe because it wasn't vented in the take out container?)  J's pepper steak was chewy and the sauteed vegetables (peppers and onions) were mushy.  As if they had been (to quote J) stewed.    We could have gotten better quality Chinese at Panda.  At least we would have known it was freshly made.

I'm not a "Chinese Food" enthusiast by any stretch.  I would almost always prefer any other asian cuisine over Chinese.  That said, I AM a potsticker fan.  And let me tell you, a good potsticker is hard to find around here.  Autumn Court has the best potstickers in the city -- by far.  So far, in fact, it's hard to believe no one has said anything about it.  I go here specifically for them.  They are not to be missed.  Other than that, I've had the fried rice, which is excellent as well (for fried rice).  My eating companion always orders the sushi, and claims it's great.  I've also tried some random dishes here and there, all about what you'd expect -- neither mind-blowing nor inedible.  I personally like the service here.  The owners and servers are humble, and helpful and, you know, nice enough.  The ambiance is above-par for a place like this in this price range.  And here is a tip for all the parents squawking about the lack of a children's menu:  order paper-wrapped chicken appetizer and a side of rice.  It's the closest thing to a kid's teriyaki chicken.  Works for me.  But seriously.  Try the potstickers.

Came here for happy hour with my Moms and was taken back by how great everything was!  Food was great and fresh! Ordered a spicy tuna roll that was actually a bit spicy unlike other places (I dig the heat!) Also had an order of potstickers that seem to filled with a homemade sausage that had a great bite to it! Excellent flavor and completely different than most other places. Lastly, we shared an order of Wor Wonton soup that was filled to the brim of the bowl with everything you'd expect!  Arvand, the bartender/server has a personality and customer service as unique as his name!  He was clear and concise with helping me choose some happy hour options as I had not dined here before. He also presented us with many options as to sauces and sides..he REALLY knows how treat customers!   With so many great options around Autumn Court, it was an easy explanation as to why I had never been inside before, but after today I will DEFINITELY be back and tell my friends!  Thanks Arvand and Autumn Court!
I had food delivered. The man on the phone was nice, but barley understood me. The food was bland. sauce was runny. Lots of food, but not worth the money.

Amazing customer service and their food is amazing! There's never a wait time when you go in for a quick bite to eat for lunch and the vegetarian/vegan options are endless! Great restaurant in the heart of Arcadia!
Terrible, terrible, terrible.  I ordered delivery.  Chow mein and I threw the whole thing away. I will never, ever eat there again.

Should have read the reviews about delivery. DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY HERE!  I got home on a sunday evening a little bit hangry and SPECIFICALLY ordered from this place because it was 8:50 and they didnt close until 10 (I'm not the kinda guy to order from a place 10 minutes before they close. They give me a delivery time of 9:47.  I wait and wait and wait. Finally at 10:06 i get a notification that the food is marked as "delivered."  wut.  tried reaching out to the restaurant but no one answered.    So yeah. I can't speak to the food, but the delivery service non existent in my eyes.

Ordered delivery via Yelp. Arrived fast (thanks Yelp and whatever that courier service was). The food was plentiful and very delicious. Not the best in the world but definitely better than average. Will probably order again some month.

So I was scanning the reviews for this restaurant and starting laughing when I realized one of them was from my sister Irene V.  I'm happy to say that her experience matched up with what I met up with tonight.   When I called my order was taken quickly and they happily accepted my request to substitute the 2 steamed white rice orders that came with entrees with an order of egg fried rice. I split things with Japanese and Chinese items for variety1.  Spiny tuna roll was very good with a nice presentation...there is nothing worse than seeing a sloppy put together roll.  The crunchy roll had some good flavor and texture.  The tuna sashimi was a very generous portion to the point that I decided to cut each slice in half because they were so big.   I stopped by to pick things up 30 minutes later and was promptly greeted by a woman upon walking in the door.  I'm pretty sure she stands by the window when she sees headlights and is waiting for you to walk in the front door.  The bartender had my order ready and even hooked me up with some extra hot mustard and duck sauce upon request.  After getting home I realized that they had already given me more than enough originally, but the extra was a nice touch.  No scowls upon hearing me as for more, but instead a smile and "no problem".   After getting home and unpacking things I was a little confused...the food was all there but there was a bonus item.  Tortillas.  WTF?  Conversation going on in my head:  "Are these tortillas?" -yes "I didn't realize tortillas were a Chinese food" -they aren't you dumb ass "Oh.  But why are they in our food" -because this is Arizona you idiot. (no judgement because I have Ally McBeal type conversations with myself)

The atmosphere in this place is very relaxing and the owner is so nice and attentive. Sushi and chinese are available. Great, quiet date place with friendly bartenders and there are always drink specials it seems.   I find this a great date place b/c of the dark-sh, quiet atmosphere.  The food is okay, not the best chinese I've had which disappoints me because everything else about this place rocks, but the food isn't as fresh as it could be.  I will definitely go again because it is close to my house though and because the owner is so amazing.
the sushi is not worth it. it just tastes old and crusty.  the americanized chinese version of sweet and sour and kung pao are worth trying here!

Possibly the single worst Chinese restaurant I've experienced and there have been a lot. I would tell my friends not to go near this place and my enemies to make a bee-line for Autumn Court. The food was very bland to say the least which is far from typical for a Chinese restaurant.

Been here a few times and I always enjoy the food.  I think of this place as having good ,but not exciting or overly spectacular, food.  Service has always been spot on for me.  The dinner choices are pretty standard, but I've only have a few of the most common ones, Orange Chicken, fried rices, a few other stir fry's etc.  So the sushi thing. I've never had anything but the rolls here. They're big, more than one bite for each piece, and come with about 8 pieces each.   I like them. I know that a Crunchy roll or a Spider roll may not be true sushi but I don't care I still like them. Damn good I tell ya.

Having lived in the Valley when Autumn Court was on Central Avenue, I was extremely excited to finally get the chance to eat there for a brunch with family. I was so disappointed in my experience! First of all there was no one to seat up when we walked in. My step-dad finally had to go an knock on the kitchen door so someone could come out for us. Then after being seated, we waited for about 10 minutes until a busser passed by and we asked him to take our drink order. After he took our order, another man came over and asked for our drink order. When we told him the busser had taken our order, he get sort of angry and walked away. Then, neither of them returned with our drinks! Finally a 3rd person came out with our drinks and took our order. After another wait, we needed our drinks refilled; we saw the busser and flagged him down since he was on his smartphone. He came over to us, and after finding out what we needed, he said, "I'll get the guy for you." Meaning...? Then he sent the 2nd server out to us for the drink reorder, who then sent the busser out to take our drink order! It was a hot mess! We finally got our food, which to be honest wasn't bad, just not worth the wait. We will not be returning anytime soon, but I will be willing to give it another try sometime.

I have learned to ignore the good reviews here and focus on the negatives.  Good restaurants don't have significant criticism, the poor reviews usually have to do with something other than the quality and flavor of the food.   This is a review of a bad restaurant.  How this restaurant could get good reviews for their food is beyond me.  It is flavorless and exceedingly sweet, like a cup of sugar on each dish sweet.  Even the hot and sour soup is sugary sweet.      The egg rolls are the worst kind, thick wrappers  that turn flabby and tough the minute they start to cool, and filled with flavorless cabbage.   Straight to the trash for these inedible little nasties.     The sesame chicken is a plate full of soggy stringy chicken bits served with the sugar/soy sauce on the side.  I suppose the gratuitous presence of 6 or 7 sesame seeds floating on that dark oily surface of the sauce gives the dish its name.  They should more appropriately call it Soggy Sugar Chicken.  Sugar Chicken, meet the trash can.  A similar sauce topped the Beef with Snow Peas.  I suspect that they use the same sauce on many dishes.    The beef might have been good had it not been aswim in that sugary bland concoction.   The snow peas were irrelevant to the dish, having been cooked into near oblivion.    The brown rice on the side is fine.  That I will eat.  I haven't worked up the nerve to try the wonton soup, and perhaps I never will.   At some point you have to know when to cut your losses.  My food was delivered through GrubHub.   It took 20 minutes longer than the longest end of the time frame they gave me.  So of course, the food was cold.     Another live and learn moment, I'm especially working on learning how to like being hungry, since I blew my food budget for two days on that food.  Yuck

Went for lunch. Hardly anyone in the place. Service was fine and food was "ok". Not that I needed more but i thought portions were a little small. Had lunch specials but not a lot too choose from. My quest continues.

Our family and I have been coming to this delicious restaurant for over 15 years and it's our absolute favorite Chinese Restaurant. The service is pleasant and welcoming. The menu has great dishes and taste amazing! Some of our recommendations are the Bean Curb Soup, Szechuan Eggplant and Dan Dan Noodles! Raymond the owner is loving and treats the customers with a great deal of respect. This is a must try-hands down!! Super Yummy!!!

Ordered the sweet & sour pork. Nothing special but I sure did get bad food poisoning from it. If you want basic "Chinese" food just go to Panda Express. Even though the servers didn't refill waters, they were nice. That's the only good thing I can say about this place.

Beautiful restaurant, superior waitstaff, fair price and VERY nicely prepared curry, rolls and H/S soup. they are conservative with salt so a dash of soy puts it together for my taste. Actually a nice way to serve Chinese! A new favorite for me!

I would consider it average chinese takeout. I ordered the General Tso's chicken and the crab rangoon and it was more than enough food- I definitely have leftovers. I'd order again if craving Chinese. Otherwise, I wouldn't go out of my way for it again.

The food just didn't have any flavor.  And now my stomach hurts.  The guy that took my order was lovely, the delivery guy (possibly same guy) was very sweet.  It's just that the food has no flavor.  Also the apps were burned.  I mean I'm definitely not hungry now, but I could have accomplished that for less than $45 (three people ordering entrees and two starters).  I won't be ordering from there again.  I heard good things about this place, but I'm just becoming more convinced good Chinese food in Phoenix (or Arizona) doesn't exist.

I hate leaving this place a two star review because the food is so delicious. Unfortunately the service was the worst I've ever experienced. Before I dive into that I will say take out is a 5 star review. If you like your Chinese food New York Style loaded in sauce, this is your place.  The entire service start to finish only kept getting worse. We had 4 different people not sure which one was our waiter. I ordered a mixed drink of the menu and the guy had no clue what I was ordering and said he never heard of it. I had to explain and show him the menu. The forgot to bring rice three times after asking a new person brought it out. They forgot a entree and all of our egg rolls. In our party of 6 all the food came out separate.   I requested a drink refill twice and had to go to bar to order a drink and pay separately. It was horrible.   The bartender is great and if I go back to dine in I will definitely be sitting at the bar.

We took the kids and met some friends at Autumn Court for dinner... the food and service was great, the prices were ok but I was disappointed that they didn't have a kids menu.      They have a large menu and I wanted something new and ordered the curry chicken which turned out not pleasing ... next time I'll just stick to the traditional Chinese dishes.

We decided to pay homage to the faux Jewish tradition of "Chinese food on Christmas" and ate here... on Christmas.  We ended up getting the Kung Pao equivalent of coal in our stocking.  I really wanted to like Autumn Court.  A lot.  It's in my neighborhood and not a chain and gets glowing reviews from many-a-Yelper.  Didn't happen.  The owner is a very nice guy but apparently some of his staff had skipped town to Tucson (or something).  I empathize but that ain't our problem.  So he was running around, food came out very slow (our soup never came), the check came out even slower and I'd consider it all pretty average fare.  (Nothing like the turbo speed of China Chili)  It was forgettable Chinese at best.  The restaurant's ambience is nice on the inside with a bar & TVs.  It is bright and clean and welcoming.   I will give this place another shot but the people who have called this "the best Chinese restaurant in Phoenix" went to an Autumn Court in another time, place and/or dimension.

I liked the ambiance of this place, which is obviously a neighborhood go-to place for many for inexpensive Chinese food. It had the feel like I stepped back into the late 1990s, and even the music they were playing was mostly from that period.  The problem is that the food we had was simply unremarkable at best.  Our chicken dish was deep fried way too hard, covered unceremoniously with some kind of canned sour sauce. Our black mushroom dish was similarly unattractive, tasting like it was made from canned/frozen vegetables and served to us swimming in a thin luke-warm gravy.  This is another good example of a restaurant that isn't really bad so much as it's just not good.

Ordered delivery.  Arrived on time and order was complete, and hot. The kong pow chicken was well wrapped to prevent spilling. The fried rice was moist and had a mild flavor. The crab wontons were a tad bland the egg roll was average but good. The vegetable tempura was terrible, all the brockley was burnt, the zucchini and eggplant was soggy, the green beans were the only eatable part, but the batter was flavorless, save a oily taste typical of expenses fryer greese that had not been changed in a while. The kong pow was spicy and decent - but had a very different flavor, more like a Thai chili sauce than kong pow. -- overall average, just do not order fried stuff.
Don't eat here ever I got horrible food poisoning.  I ordered the general tsos chicken witch was taste less and dry and the Kung pao chicken and shrimp they forgot the shrimp and was afull stay away
terrific place, everything is fresh. So far I only dined at the restaurant, intend to try their take out soon.

Some of the best Chinese food I have had in Phoenix. Very fresh colorful presentation, great tea, great service, nice atmosphere. The menu is extensive with plenty of meals under $10.  We arrived around 7pm and were promptly seated. I tried the Kung Pao Chicken which was very good (could have been a little hotter) and "my partner in crime" chose the orange chicken - she raved about it.   The egg drop soup was excellent, the crab puffs sublime, and the fortune cookies crap (aren't they always).

Seeing a sign saying voted best in Phoenix next to a huge A health rating sounds like a good bet right? No. So I ordered the spicy orange chicken and my friend ordered the "crispy" honey chicken. With your dish you get chicken. Oh, and a bowl of steamed rice, it was mostly chicken. The crispy honey chicken wasn't crispy. I'd really rather have smaller portions in exchange for some veggies. Nothing really had a flavor worth savoring. And as far as the A rating goes, how clean is a restaurant where everyone's shoes stick to the ground? Great potential but definitely not worth the time or money. We actually left without paying and with less than half out food eaten due to such poor quality and execution. Oh, and after reading this to my friend before posting, he clarified to me that the health rating is a year old. WHY IS IT STILL UP?!

This place is a great lunch option during a busy workday. We go here often and are able to get in and out in less than 30 minutes with 5 people. Their lunch menu is extensive and affordable and everything I've tried so far has been delicious.

Friendly staff,  we even got to talk to the owner.   I ordered beef chow fun & my husband ordered beef with sizzling vegetables. Both dishes were very good.  I think the most important part was the service,  without great service forget it.   We will be back.

Had the Mongolian steak and some house Low-Mein. Everything is very bland and tasteless. Other than the color of the meat, it's hard to tell what you're eating and afterwards, well, let's just say it didn't sit very well. Won't be back.

I've eaten here a few times and this is definitely the best Chinese food in Phoenix - - I always get the lemon chicken and I am never disappointed. It's a bit pricey for Chinese food but the portions are generous. The only down side is that this place is not very kid-friendly - they don't have a kids menu which I found to be disappointing. They also serve sushi here and their potstickers and egg rolls are delicious.

The best thing to order here would be the Crispy Noodle Chow Mein and the soup.  Ask for the combo with shrimp and portk ribs.  Delicious!!  This is the only thing that I have tried because it was my favorite from the get go!  Service is always amazing!!

This is difficult to give a rating to!  Delivery was sooner than what I expected!  Good!  My first bite into the scallops dish that I ordered had that sharp, metallic flavor that scallops can sometimes have, which was an immediate turnoff and a little scary....but I kept eating it.  The sharp taste was only in the first one.  Also, I guess i should remember that scallops are somewhat 'porous" and will absorb flavors and colors from dishes in which they are combined so my scallops adopted a somewhat brownish cast.....tasted fine; looked funny.  The Mongolian Beef was delicious.  I love the beef used in Chinese food, and theirs was perhaps the best I've ever tasted in the Valley, and certainly the most tender.  The eggrolls are good sized and tasty....I hate it when egg rolls are so small they might be mistaken for someone's finger!  These were closer to what I was used to back home.  So, difficult to rate because some was good and some, not so much.  That first scallop just about put me off my meal!

My sister ordered food from here last night. She let me have some and it was so amazingly good a fresh I went back for a second plate! I love how the sauce was separate from the chicken to keep it fresh and crispy when we got it. The noodle in the chow menu were also surprisingly fresh too. The texture of them was amazing! It wasn't too soft like it was overcooked or sitting in sauce for too long.and it wasn't to hard like it was undercooked. I really don't understand how they kept delivery noodles with sauce so fresh. I almost wonder if they make the noodles from scratch? I was so impressed yesterday that today I thought I'd yep the restraunt and see what other good food they have. I was shocked when I saw the rating was so low! I have had worse food on Yelp that had more stars then this place it just doesn't seem fair. The $ rating also seems to be off it should be $ not $$.  My tip for this place is don't judge by the raiting  or buy the $$. Both are wrong. I recommend the sesame chicken and veggie low main.(my iPad won't let me spell this right)

Looked like a great menu I ordered online for delivery they charged me $50, then an hour and a 1/2 later I called them to find out where my order was and they said they cancelledit.  they had no delivery people.  I asked why they didn't call me and tell me they cancelled it. They didn't have a delivery person. I say I should  get my money back?

Ordered delivery. Beef chow fun; beef and noodles were mushy and overcooked, dish was a quarter white onions. Ribs appetizer; way too sweet and overcooked and chewy. Mushroom beef; not a single mushroom, half white and green onion. That's three out of three. Crossed off my Chinese food list.
I consider this the best Chinese food restaurant in town. Great fresh food and the service is always great. Definitely recommend you try it for sure.
Make sure they repeat your order when placing a pickup order, had to come back twice because of the mistakes in taking the order. The owner fixed it without a question.

The food here is very good! While some of the waiters do need a little practice, the Chinese couple that runs this store are awesome. My boyfriend and I love coming here.  Also, it is vegetarian friendly. Big plus!

Really nice little place I've seen so many times but have never been to. I was surprised how "western" it was on the inside. I always passed it off as another chinese restaurant. The lo mein was alright. There were mostly locals on a Friday night. They all seemed very friendly and accepting of newbies at the bar with them. Will most likely be back.
This is a great restaurant. The food is amazing. Tried a couple different appetizers and they were all sooo good. All the entrees we tried as well came out in a timely manner and were scrumptious.

If you are looking for great Chinese food go no further! Restaurant is always clean and smells amazing when you walk in! King our server (I think he is also the owner) always greats us with the sweetest and most sincere gestures making sure we are happy and taken care of! I always start with The hot tea, it is so refreshing! This time I got the spicy orange chicken dinner and oh my goodness like the best Chinese food I have ever had! The portions are huge! The dinner is also served with a big thing of white rice, egg flower soup, and your choice of egg roll or crab puffs all for like 12$! The soup is outstanding, the rice is perfectly cooked, and the crab puffs are so delicious but addictive ( you have been warned). My boyfriend got the sesame chicken dinner which was also super yummy ( even though I do not like sesame) and his brothers general tang chicken was hands down tasty goodness! You will not leave hungry or upset if you eat here! Yeah serves can be slow at times but you should just sit back and enjoy the wonderful food offered here! Also the serves is always friendly which can not be said about many places any more! You should definitely give here a try I guarantee it will be some of the best Chinese you have ever had!

Yummy-licious! I miss Chinese food from New York. This is *very* close and a super cute place. My friend and I made a long lunch here and thoroughly enjoyed it.   Walking in we were immediately greeted like old friends and directed to a booth. I ordered a green ice tea, which, hold your pants, I've never ordered in my entire life. Scandal. Yes. It was incredibly refreshing. And served in, quite possibly, one of the biggest glasses ever. (They refilled this later, but honestly, there was no need.)  They offer a great lunch special (11am-4pm). Your meal comes with an egg roll OR wok fried lo-mein, white fried rice + an egg roll. For $7.50 I went with the Kung Pao Chicken and Shrimp. I "upgraded" to brown rice for a $1. My friend added an upgrade for $1 of egg drop soup (which she raved about).  We both cleaned our plates. There was nothing left. Nada. If you look at my photo there was a generous serving of food provided. That stuff was goood!

Finally, after all these years living in this area tried Autumn Court for dinner. The waitress was excellent. She took our order and got our drinks quickly.  She checked back periodically and refilled our drinks without having to be asked. The appetizer we selected was pot stickers, nice and crispy, yum. For our entrees we had sweet and sour chicken and beef broccoli. The food was really good, nice flavors and good portions but I heard the young guys on the staff say FUCK, SHIT and DAMN probably over 20 times each during our hour eating dinner.   The young men should realize diners may not care for all the curse words. I say my fair share of curse words but there is an appropriate time and place.  I'll probably do take out next time.

I have been coming to Autumn Court for 4 years now and I have to tell you this is the best Chinese food around. Yes the service is shaky and the place needs a revamp but it is delicious every time and the SOUP!! All of them are so good you have to try them!!

Here's the deal- I really like some of the food at Autumn Court. Their Szechuan eggplant with ground chicken is out of this world! So flavorful with just enough spice. mmmm.  The husband also likes their orange chicken. The thing is, their prices are a bit high if you don't go for lunch....remedy? Just go for lunch. They even offer lunch specials on the weekend until 4pm and the items are mostly under 10$. The portions are large enough for two meals (for me anyway). The lunch also comes with an eggroll and white rice. If you want soup, it's around 1$ more depending on which soup you get. Their hot and sour is ok and I like their wonton (it has bok choy in it, which is kinda different and tasty).    So why only 3 stars? The main reason is the service. The service here is just sad. It's usually suuuuuper slow as they often have too few employees working (especially around lunch time). We've had some waiters that have been nice, and one waiter who was less nice. Also, I saw one of their waiters carrying water glasses with his thumbs on the inside of the glass (you know, so his thumbs were in the waters.....yuck). This won't stop me from coming back to Autumn Court, but it does lessen the appeal of the restaurant. Also, we had their potstickers once and they were very odd and not so good.....they were super dense sausages inside of the noodle..... unlike any potsticker I've ever had. Can't recommend that. Lastly, they have an odd happy hour here....it's all sushi, which I found strange given that the restaurant is generally a Chinese food place.   Overall, I would recommend Autumn Court. The good definitely outweighs the bad.

Only got take out from here. I will have to try dining in. The food was delicious and ready fast. We ordered lemon chicken, beef fried rice, and egg rolls. All of it was delicious and reasonably priced. Portions were big too so leftovers for lunch!

UUGH!! What a dissapointment!!  The manager/waiter/owner/whatever was sooooo nice and the interior felt right somehow.  then the hot and sour soup came out and it was filled with goodies.  Yum!  So everything went straight downhill from there. I ordered the chicken and shrimp Kung Pao extra hot and spicy.   I got almost no spice or heat at ALL. Then the sauce had an odd ,almost lumpy texture.  The shrimp were beautifully cooked and plump (all three of them) but you could tell that they had been added to some leftover, reheated chicken Kung Pao with the worlds smallest shreds of chicken. Even the vegetables were teeny tiny shreds.   I am NOT KIDDING when I say that the peanuts were bigger.  The brown rice I asked for was delicious.  The Lo Mein was the worst  I have ever tasted.  Gluey, cold, old, bland, spiceless and frankly, gross. I never, ever, EVER leave food on my plate, but this just wasn't worth eating much of it. My companion ordered the Moo Goo Gai Pan.  Oh, YUCK! Enough said.  Two stars for the man at the door and the hot and sour soup and maybe one of those ginger vodka martinis if I ever go back and get one. Oh, and some crazy person said get the egg rolls?  It was BURNT. No thanks.

I got take out from here tonight and it was good. Not amazing, but good enough for what it was. $20 fed three of us with leftovers. Their white rice was a bit sticky, but the friend rice was num-num.  Is it sad that I was most impressed with their to-go boxes? They're made of sturdy tupperware quality plastic and you can microwave them and re-use them.

The food here is disappointing. The lo mein was too salty and the honey walnut shrimp sauce was lacking in both quality and quantity. I give them 2 stars though, because they deliver... it takes an hour though. Not great.
If you're thinking about eating here my suggestion is not to. Not terrible but not good either. Don't order a Long Island.

Terriable Terriable who ever left a good review to this please basically doesn't know how to eat I pacifically told them " well done extra dark " on the pork fried rice it was mushy and no pork in the rice ! Beef low main was so mushy and not dark gross ! The egg rolls was soft not crunchy I'm from New York and Florida and wo hop in New York now that's Chinese food and Christine lees at gulf stream in Florida that's good Chinese food this was Terriable !

I have been going to this place for over 4 years, always great food and prompt service.  Carli was amazing last night and we got the Orange Chicken and the Duck with brown rice.  Can't wait to go back and have more.

I visit Autumn Court at least once every other week, usually on Fridays. The happy hour is great and my husband loves the Pad Thai! Service is wonderful and our favorite bartender is one that we can call a friend! This is one place everyone has to try at least once.

Some of the best Chinese around. I have tried all of there lunch specials and none disappoint. The Cashew Chicken and Ground Eggplant lunch specials are the best I have ever had and don't forget the Wonton soup, it's awesome.   Service is quick and done with a smile.

Hit or miss at best.  Last night when I called a male answered the phone and was anything but willing to take my order.  They have delivered to my area several times before but not last night, all sorts of creative excuses came up.    THE RUDE EMPLOYEE FROM LAST NIGHT SHOULD BE FIRED!    Not sure WHO the manager is, but if your employees are making business decisions for you, thats not the kind of place I am going to engage with any further.  Guess what, you just lost a customer who was ordering weekly and giving a generous tip to your driver each time.    My recommendation to everyone, STAY AWAY!!!

I ordered some takeout Mongolian Beef and fried rice the other night, and it was ridiculously delicious. I haven't had the easiest time finding high-quality Chinese food in the Phoenix area, but it looks like I found my new favorite place! The decor is cute and quaint too which is always a plus.

I've eaten here off and on for about 10 years but haven't been in a long while till today (it's been several years actually). I love their lemon chicken because the sauce has the perfect sweet and tart taste and they used to use actual chicken breasts to fry the chicken and then top it with the sauce and you knew exactly what you were getting. I went today and was super sad to see that they now use the pre-cut and breaded chicken pieces that have more breading than chicken. the sizzling rice soup was good and veggies in there were fresh but the soup was a little on the salty side. We also ordered the peppered beef, Szechwan string beans, and honey walnut shrimp. I love salty food and all, but they seriously went overboard with the salt in every dish and it was hard to finish our food. The server took out cups away for water refills rather than bringing a pitcher and refilling it at the table, so I'm sure I got my friends cup and someone else got mine. the atmosphere is nice, it's dark and more romantic date night feel but I probably won't be coming back. here are pics of our food but it was really dark so the pics didn't come out too great.

SOOOOO GOOD! I've been looking for a good Chinese place down here and so far every delivery place I've tried has been mediocre until now! We got the sweet and sour chicken, Kung pao veggie dish, and fried/white rice. All delicious and the delivery man was really nice too! (Took a little over an hour though) 100% recommend!!

What I enjoyed about Autumn court was the vegetarian options. The atmosphere is very cool and clean (I like the design/layout). The staff was very nice and timely.   I have had great experience and have decided to bring my whole family here soon. Give it a try!

So, going on Christmas, always a risk. There was a wait and 2 parties in front of my group left. There we people waiting for their pick up order for over 20 minutes. But when we asked how long it would be until we got sat and would have our food we were told 15 minutes. He was true to his word on that.    The food was good. The egg rolls were awesome. We didn't really have a waiter tending to us, but that was ok. the bus person got us more water when we asked. I would probably go here again if I was in the area, but I would just as soon have the Panda.
